website_summaries.verdict: Great value. It throws a variety of objects, is built well, and stays put. It is an excellent option for improving hitting.
pros: Throws anything from hardballs to volleyballs

customer_reviews.title: Very fun!
customer_reviews.text: It takes about 5 minutes to calibrate to consistently get a good pitch. After that, it's very accurate. I saw a video saying that it moves around a lot even with the stakes. Not so. It only moves around if you jerk the handle when releasing the pitch. Pull smoothly and no problems. Pitching machines of this accuracy usually cost way more and you have to find an outlet with a multiple extension chords. What a hassle. This requires no electricity and is decently priced. It took about 10 minutes to put it together. You need a 9/16 wrench, a crescent wrench, and a large flat-head screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: RWC

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased Dad and Son!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my son to use at home for practicing machine pitch baseball. He is 4 years old and was moved from T-ball to machine pitch due to his ability and size. My husband wanted him to get used to the rhythm of hitting off of a machine, and Amazon had the best price and the same one used by the league. It is used 4 days/week for practice, is easy to maneuver, and can be put in the trunk of a car, back of a station wagon, SUV, etc. This is a must have for young ball players (and Dad's alike who get sore arms!)to practice. Another great purchase from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: DeafEdTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useful but needs some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome training tool once you take the time to get it dialed in. I found it to be challenging to get it at the right height and speed for the kids without a fair amount of time spent tweaking the micro adjustments. The micro adjustments are made with a butterfly nut which also increases the amount of time it takes to test it out. I would recommend that Louisville look into some sort of quick micro adjustment setup that allows for easier tweaking and on the fly changes. Aside from the micro adjustments once you get it dialed in it is pretty effective and the kids really enjoyed hitting off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Takes time and effort to get it set in place to pitch
customer_reviews.text: The pitch is much more consistent than if I were pitching to my son. BUT to get it set in the right place so that it pitches consistently in the strike zone is a matter of error and trial. It is always wrong at the beginning and it is difficult to get it right. Small adjustments are usually needed for the first 10 - 20 pitches. My 12 year old son is 84 lbs and it is very difficult for him to hold down the spring with his weight in trying to pitch to his brother. It does pitch better than the cheap electric machines but you will get a good workout in operating it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dorlon

customer_reviews.title: Very good pitching machine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The product was packaged well. Directions were very easy to follow. Tools needed are a 9/16” wrench and a Phillips head screw driver. Pretty lightweight and easy to move around. After three throws, I had the machine dialed in to an almost exact strike zone. Some were a few inches high and few inches low, it all were in the strike zone.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Swartz

customer_reviews.title: It takes a little practice, but afterwards it works well!
customer_reviews.text: Louisville Slugger UPM 45 Blue Flame Pitching Machine This machine is totally erratic! How do I get it to throw strikes for middle schoolers? It is either 3-5 feet too wide or 3-5 feet too high! Update 4/18- changed from 1 star to 4 stars. Other Amazon users said to keep practicing with it and it will work well. They were right, after you get the hang of it, it is very good. But the front has to be anchored down to eliminate the pitches from being too wide! asked on April 9, 2018
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Great way to spend enjoyable time with sons/grandsons
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our grandson who loves playing baseball. He was having a little trouble with his batting and wanted parents and grandparents to throw the balls so he could practice. Grandma is a terrible thrower and grandpa was afraid he would it him, but we love doing things for our grandkids. The first day we got it Grandpa and grandson spent hours not just enjoying batting practice but spending time together. We left it at their house and now Mom and Dad get to spend quality hours with this machine and their son. It works great!!! Easy set up and easy to move and/or store.
customer_reviews.author: S Rose

customer_reviews.title: It's great. She started at the middle setting and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Daughter has gotten to the point where she wont swing at 'bad' pitches. Says daddy throw strikes. I cannot throw consistent strikes at the speeds i want (higher than a lob) so i bought this to try. It's great. She started at the middle setting and it took some time to get it but once she did her swings were level and easily eyeing up the ball for solid contact. I do not agree with it being good for grounders or popups. just use a bat or throw those by hand. but for pitching - this is a great,electric free option.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: A Gift to Coaches' Arms
customer_reviews.text: I have coached for more than 17 years and this is the single best addition I have made to my practices. I coach a 12U baseball team and my kids have struggled to improve their hitting because pitching has been so inconsistent. We used this machine at practice and our coaching staff was able to actually show our boys that changes in their swings result in better contact because the pitches were consistent. Trust me, $150 is worth it to any coach to see his kids improve. We haven't used it for fly balls yet but I expect it will be just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Huneycutt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & accurate pitching
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took about 15 minutes. The machine is sturdy in terms of structure. I gave 4 stars due to the bolt that holds the spring on because it seems like there should be a washer or something to hold it in place. I did adjust it back in place after several pitches so the bolt wouldn’t bend. Overall it’s a good machine for my daughter to practice on and very easy to use. There are several adjustments you can make in order to have the right height/distance pitch for your ball player too.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Training Aid
customer_reviews.text: If you are not getting consistent pitches, check the balls you’re using for weight variances. If you have baseballs accumulated from over the years, some Rawlings some MacGregor some water logged some not some little league some major league obviously you are not going to have the same trajectory with each pitch. Get this machine and a bucket of new balls and see how you can consistently pitch with predictability.
customer_reviews.author: Venia

customer_reviews.title: So glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I got this machine cause I have so much trouble tossing softballs for BP. So glad I did. Nothing on the market this practical and affordable. It consistently throws strikes ! There is no need to have electricity and It was super easy to set up . My wife was using it to throw the kids perfect pitches everytime . We have 350 pitches on this thing in one day of use . A must buy for recreational slow pitch softball .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blue Flame, Red Flame 🔥
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product to teach live pitching. Builds confidence in hitting! Thank ya, thank ya, thank ya very much...
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy and Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Saw this at my sons little league game---had to have it. We love it. Perfect adjustable pitches, fly balls and awesome grounders. Definitely worth the money. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: My issue is one of a kind I guess. The pull pin is too big and wouldn’t get into any of the wholes on a power pedal. Contacted customer service. They replied right away and sent replacement part. Overall, the machine is ok, we have been using those in our machine pitch league for years, the accuracy is not great, especially if the balls get a little wet, but does work for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install.
customer_reviews.text: I just received it, I was able to install it in 15 min, the instructions are easy to follow. The product looks rigid and sturdy, easy to use! Taking it to the park today to test it out..
customer_reviews.author: Carlos E.

customer_reviews.title: Don't let one person use it too long at one time, strong spring
customer_reviews.text: The pitching machine works pretty good. But don't let one person do the pitching to long or they may not be able to walk in a few days. The spring is pretty strong and after a hundred or so pitches that person will know it not right awya but in a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: A good machine
customer_reviews.text: My slow pitch pitching skills suck but this machine saves the day! I really like how adjustable it is. I can easily go from USSSA flat pitching to senior 12' arc pitching. It says it can throw a 60 mph fast ball and I wouldn't doubt it. The machine is well made and well thought out. A nice piece of engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Keeps moving out of position
customer_reviews.text: Very overrated! It throws 15 balls for each strike because it CONSTANTLY moves out of position. I can't believe that it got such great reviews. Honestly, I'm better off just throwing the damn balls myself.
customer_reviews.author: SKMG

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our kiddos baseball team since the fields we are practicing at doesn't have an outlet anywhere! It works perfect for 10U for high balls instead of hitting them out to them! Works okay for pitching but we really use this for fielding/pop ups!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bellemore

customer_reviews.title: More accurate than our electric league machines
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing already! We're just using it in the backyard, with wiffle balls and no micro-adjustments. We simply move home plate to where the balls are going. I am very pleased with the accuracy. So far, it's consistently throwing more accurate pitches than the thousand-dollar electric league machines we use here. One note: I read another review where there was a concern about kids playing with it and hitting themselves in the head. This is easily avoided when not in use by removing the pin (as the instructions recommend). When the spring is not connected, there's no danger of the throwing mechanism accidentally being activated.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: works quite well, i must say. easy to assemble (just need two 9/16 wrenches), is quite heavy and seems durable, though i wonder how long the plastic connectors will last. i prefer to the automatic machines, because it allows the batter to consider what he or she did wrong on the previous swing, or for a coach to offer a suggestion before firing the next ball. we are curious to see what it will do with snowballs.
customer_reviews.author: BrilliantBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: It throws really great fastballs, best if you use same type balls, we have a mix of southern league (AA), 12U and Dizzy Dean balls and they all throw slightly different. Also needs a better anchor, each throw moved machine slightly to the right.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Great for hitting practice
customer_reviews.text: It only takes about 5 mins to get this on target. I really like how every pitch is a little different. It appears confusing at first on how it works but once you have it on the field, it is simple. It is helping my son get his timing down. I do wish the legs were foldable but you can it off with the screw knob. Would recommend this product highly
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Well Built

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up last year as a supplemental pitch machine to use for my baseball team as field practices with the power and jugs machine (spinning wheel) were far and few between. Being able to bring anywhere for practice was key and come to find out the Blue Flame was more dependable and accurate then the league provided spinning wheel machine. Fast forward to this season and the machine has "caught on" within our league and is now the pitch machine used at all of our games! Great purchase that you wont regret!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty rad
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to help your kid get better at hitting if you stink at pitching. This eliminates that problem. Can take to any field nearby too since it doesn’t need electricity. Unfortunately my kid can’t pitch to me with it. The arm is too hard for him to push down. Otherwise works well for what we want.

Very disappointing and can be a serious safety issue, especially around youth baseball players. Help me with a safer option

customer_reviews.title: Wild thing

Pitches all over the place, hit him twice in two minutes, etc. Can't improve hitting if you are diving out of the box every pitch. Edit - used it again today and used the included spikes, did much better. Adding a star!
customer_reviews.author: B. D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Training Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5-year-old son and it works Amazing! Had a tough time getting a consistent pitch to him when we practiced together and this alleviated that problem allowing him to actually get some good batting practice in. Takes some time to get it in the strike zone at the right speed but once you do it's the perfect pitch from then on.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Epperson

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED to Little Leagues- Teams

customer_reviews.title: not perfect but fun.

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Used it to teach my 6 year old to hit. Worked wonders to help him get his timing down and over his fear of being hit by a pitch. Worth every penny if you kid is moving up from tball to machine pitch baseball.
customer_reviews.author: DMc

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my 10 year old and the neighborhood kids in place of my larger pitching machine. Throws accurate, easy to adjust, the kids can drag it out and use on their own safely. Great find
customer_reviews.author: Moneypit01264

customer_reviews.title: Dont chase bad pitches any more
customer_reviews.text: The hardest thing to find is someone that can throw strikes when you want to work on your hitting. Nothing worse than running all over the place to swing and when you finally get a pitch in the strike zone you get so excited you miss hit it. This machine allows anyone to pitch to you and you know 90% of the balls with be within the hitting zone. Best thing I have bought in 25 years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for improving my 6 year old son’s timing.
customer_reviews.text: The machine is easy to use. It’s fairly accurate (will hit a 6 year old size strike zone 4 out of 5 times). Sometimes I wish it were more accurate but honestly it’s better because it helps kids pick their pitch. It’s just as accurate if not more so than the expensive wheel type machines that he hits off of during the real games. BUT, It will pitch pretty wild if using random brand, weight, age balls. After buying a new bucket of matching balls I was very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just need to watch more youtube
customer_reviews.text: Bout have used in on different areas but just can't seem to get the ball to stay consistent. It will throw 4 good balls then 2 or 3 bad ones, then 1 good one then back to bad. Have tried putting boards under to make adjustments because the adjustments on it make major changes at the plate. It is an ongoing battle for accuracy. Maybe need to watch more how to videos over it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good pitching machine.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, works well, very simple to set up, adjust, and use. Pitches are sometimes inconsistent, but so are pitchers. Have used at 35 mph to speed with softballs, so cannot comment on claims of speed with the hard plastic balls and baseballs, but am sure it performs, has no problem with the softballs. This is a good item fairly priced for pitching machines.
customer_reviews.author: RLT

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning!
customer_reviews.text: Niece loves it. Lost the ground pegs. But works great
customer_reviews.author: Edmund L.

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Good
customer_reviews.text: This product works better then i expect it. FYI use the same balls to be more accurate and for fly balls put something under the front stand to shot the balls high.
customer_reviews.author: TNMAGIC

customer_reviews.title: Best price from Amazon.  Works great once you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: Great little pitching machine for young players. Purchased it because our league is using them and wanted our young players to practice with it as much as possible. Easy to assemble but the directions on using it are virtually non existent. Does not throw very consistent unless the ball is placed on the arm just right. You need to have the seams of the ball in contact with the rubber ribbing running along the throwing arm. Practice with it for a while until you get it right before you use in practice. Having inconsistent pitches for young players gets frustrating for the players (and coaches). Overall good product and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Arm Saver
customer_reviews.text: Love this pitching machine! Affordable and convenient. One complaint is that a screw on the metal arm bent and i had to bend it back in place during a game, wish they were stronger. I'm looking for some stronger bolts to replace the bent one for the next game but other than that it truly is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: HonestAbe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pitching machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great. It's very easy to line up a pitch and then throw ball after ball in the strike zone. A shoulder injury has made it impossible for me to get a ball over the plate, so this is the only way I can have batting practice with my son. It's so consistent and easy to use, that I'd continue to use it even if my shoulder were healed. I highly recommend it for home and league play.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J McMahon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: 1. Very easy to assemble. 2. Perfect for helping my 11 year old daughter practice on her hitting and 3. I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Wolf00062

customer_reviews.title: No consistency what so ever
customer_reviews.text: This is misleading. Make sure to read the fine print about the mph and what balls will do what. Also does not throw accurate worth a crap. We have tried since Christmas Day multiple different variations for at least 20 balls (softballs and baseballs) each variation time to get a consistent “throw” with no luck. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool. For the money this thing is great. Takes a few minutes to dial it in from your pitch distance. But something I can amuse for years to come with my boy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Well deserved first place pitching machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase I have made for two grandsons, 11 and 13, playing summer league baseball. We practice 2 hours a day on our own. The Blue Flame saves my arm and gives them lots of practice batting, catching fly balls, and fielding grounders. Solid construction, many variations possible in ball speed and height. Please read easy instructions first for best results.

customer_reviews.title: Spring does not stay on.

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid little pitching machine
customer_reviews.text: I guess this is what the teams use in the 'Pony' (little league) baseball. It's an odd contraption, but seems to get the job done. I bought this so that my nephew and I can practice his hitting skills 'with the real thing'. He's a better hitter now, and less anxious when facing the mechanical monster, so I'm happy with the purchase. These seem pretty bullet-proof (well, at least baseball proof) and do the job well. So far after one season it's held up as expected.

customer_reviews.title: Great for batting practice and more accurate than coach pitch.

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible pitching machine.
customer_reviews.text: I used the table to initially setup, but easily adapted it for speed, arc, etc. Only takes a few minutes to go from softball, baseball and tennis balls with the same positioning to the plate. I also like the ability to slightly adjust the throw from left to right.
customer_reviews.author: DOA

customer_reviews.title: easy set up quick shipping.

I found it a few different places but this is by far the cheapest one i found and it showed up a day before it said it was going to.

I placed it just behind the pitching rubber and it throws the balls around the strike zone but not out of the strike zone so kids can get use to swinging at different pitches. I think the slight inaccuracy is more due to the balls, how the laces are placed than it is something with the pitching machine.

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered: It has worked for us. Your results might be different!
customer_reviews.text: Two Games, two home runs and a triple. All for a girl who could not hit beyond the pictures mound last year. This year, every show is landing in the outfield. Last night we almost cleared the fence. I am talking about my nine-year-old. Your results might differ, but this has been our year. The only change is that we started practicing with the Louisville Slugger UPM 45 Blue Flame Pitching Machine
customer_reviews.author: Lionel

customer_reviews.title: Portable and accurate
customer_reviews.text: It was really easy to assemble and pretty easy to dial in. I've found it really accurate and consistent horizontally so no danger of hitting my kids. But there seems to be some variation in the height of the pitches. Which isn't bad because if give them some variety. Over all I think it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Sheriff

customer_reviews.title: Works great for slow pitch too.
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent for slowpitch practice. It throws far more accurate than most people can. Allows you to get many quality swings in. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works good for what we needed. And the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Tattood Texan!

customer_reviews.title: Best product I used of its kind
customer_reviews.text: Pretty consistent and can use some tightening after a while but really have no issues. Seems to set the standard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pitching machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pitching machine! We use it for my 9 year old, 7 year old and 5 year old. The settings are easy to change to make it a little slower or faster depending on who is up to bat. It is pretty accurate as well. The machine is a lot more sturdy than I was expecting and holds great in place. It is a little hard for kids to operate and I don't let my kids play with it unless I am there helping.
customer_reviews.author: iDarc

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth the money you save
customer_reviews.text: Does not pitch very accurate is very hard to use had to buy a different machine
customer_reviews.author: jeremy larocco

customer_reviews.title: Louisville slugger upm45
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd gotten this last year! Awesome pitching machine. Kids are aggressive hitters now instead of waiting for Dad to throw a good pitch. I'm can't wait to try it for pop-up flies. The pitches are as consistent as going to a batting cage. You do have to get standardized balls. The old heavier balls do not pitch the same as new balls. If anything happened to this machine, I'd get a replacement the next day!
customer_reviews.author: BZMom

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple machine, and even my kids can set up their own balls and pitch to each other. (5, 6 &8). Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: LBell

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, great machine to practice from. Taught my daughter a lot on how to hit a ball and has a lot of different speeds from fast balls to lobbing the ball...
customer_reviews.author: sLiM

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy it is to use. We've had a lot of fun hitting balls in the backyard!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Great to use for warms
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much. So our league has it as well. One draw back it that if you have 6 teams using it 2 times a week, make sure it’s put away right. Bends Easy, light weight steel.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Fallon Jr

customer_reviews.title: Blue flame
customer_reviews.text: This a great product. My grandson and I went out and give it a shot got it dialed in and had a great time
customer_reviews.author: Casey P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine.
customer_reviews.text: This device does a great job a throwing balls in a tight 1 ft radius zone. Simply center it for throwing over the pâté, and you strike after strike in slightly different areas of the strike zone. The other part I really like is in setting the machine stepping back and pulling the release you simulate the timing of a real pitch. Lastly, this device pitches at an appropriate height for little leaguers. No more throwing the ball like darts from the one knee position. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mysterwii

customer_reviews.title: Mommy's Helper
customer_reviews.text: It's great as expected but beware, it gets out of adjustment very easy. We tried to use it in sand and had to re-adjust almost everytime due to "shifting". It needs to be on a sturdy surface to be somewhat maintenance free. It has wiggle in the setting of the ball too, but that's easily figured out. It's worth the money - just know what you're getting into.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great machine same machine that my son's 6yr old team ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine same machine that my son's 6yr old team uses. We use this in between practices and it has definitely given him the edge. He only struck out 3 times this season. It is not perfect, but it's great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick P.

customer_reviews.title: great pitching machine! Same machine they were using in my sons tball league
customer_reviews.text: This was the same pitching machine they were using in my sons tball league. I bought this to ensure he could practice with the same machine he would be using in a game. It works great! If its good enough for a city league its good enough for individual use. It is stout and preforms well. Packaged well and arrived on time as usual
customer_reviews.author: M. Flowers

customer_reviews.title: really useful
customer_reviews.text: Love this more and more every practice. Actually like it better than the mechanical pitching machines because the ball comes in a different spot almost every time. Works timing and hand eye. Just started using for pop fly practice as well. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: dominic luzi

customer_reviews.title: Great for practicing.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use!! Grandson loves it. He like practicing with it in between games.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie hamann

customer_reviews.title: Batter Up
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. My Grand Daughter increased her batting average. Fearless hitter! Easy to store, transport and put into use.
customer_reviews.author: William R Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Quality BP for pitches < 65 mph
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME. My 8 year old son is getting quality BP with this machine. Unless you need 60+ speeds, this is well worth the money. Very accurate and easy to adjust. It would be nice if there was a chart on how the micro adjustment affects the flight pattern of the ball. Trial and error is a bit cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine for 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: This works good, but I would recommend sand bags to place on the bottom, it does seem to move easily which is annoying because once you get it set perfectly to throw strikes, you don't want to keep adjusting it. Overall good value, just expensive for what it does and how much time it takes to narrow it in properly.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great machine. It works perfectly. There's just enough variability in the pitches so the kids aren't always swinging at the same strike. I can throw 100 hittable pitches to my kids with this machine in the time it could take me to make 10 good pitches if I threw them AND my arm isn't tired
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected we use one of these at coach pitch league so wanted one for the house. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brielle N.

customer_reviews.title: Great device for younger batting practice.
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to use that my 5-year-old can operate it. Consistent pitches at low speed rates make it ideal for younger batters to practice. The fact that it doesn't need electricity makes it easy to transport and use anywhere it is needed. I wish that it folded down better for storage, but it really doesn't take up that much room once it is setup.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K

product_meta.title: Louisville Slugger Blue Flame Pitching Machine
product_meta.description:
Gamemaster 200160111 Louisville Ultimate Pitching Machine (EA)

AMAZON.COM




The UPM is sturdy, portable, and requires no electricity. Named the official Pony Baseball and Softball League pitching machine, the Ultimate Pitching Machine (UPM) 45 helps batters and coaches enjoy a more successful batting practice or coach-pitch game. It's sturdy, portable, and requires no electricity, which makes it great for practices and games, home or away. Plus it saves the coach's arm. Because the lever action flicks baseballs with consistent speed and location, it's often used as an alternative in coach-pitch leagues to help overcome the fear factor of live pitching. Young hitters will know where and when the ball will be pitched. For all ages, the UPM model 45 allows hitters to work on specific locations and sharpen muscle memory without turning the coach's arm to jelly.  The Louisville Slugger UPM45 is the ultimate training aid that pitches reliably and consistently for batter after batter allowing the hitter to concentrate on developing a proper level swing path to the ball. The UPM45 is more than just a pitching machine, though--it also throws accurate fly-balls and hard ground balls consistently to incorporate into your drills and eliminate the need for hitting the ball during drills. 

 

The Louisville Slugger UPM 45 Blue Flame Pitching Machine throws real baseballs and softballs between 18 and 45 miles per hour and soft, lightweight balls up to 60 miles per hour. This machine has been authorized for use by teams in the majority of youth leagues in America including Babe Ruth Baseball and Softball, the Cal Ripken Division of Babe Ruth Baseball, 



The UPM allows hitters to work on specific locations and sharpen muscle memory without turning the coach's arm to jelly. Pony League Baseball and Softball, and many more. 

 For coaches and team managers, the UPM solves any number of problems. There's no need to use special pitching machine balls - it won't rip or tear leather or synthetic ball covers. 

 Features: 

 * Portable and lightweight at only 25 pounds 
 * Mechanical pitching machine perfect for throwing accurate pitches, infield drills, and outfield drills 
 * No batteries or electricity required 
 * Throws regulation baseballs and fastpitch softballs up to 45 miles per hour 
 * Throws lightweight practice baseballs and softballs up to 60 miles per hour 
 * Throws slowpitch softballs with up to a 12-foot arch 
 * Throws accurate fly balls and hard ground balls
feature_bullets: Throws any type of ball, hard balls, fast pitch softballs, dimple balls, light flight, plastic and even soccer and volleyballs
Throws hard balls from 18 to 45 mph with easy to adjust speed controls. And throws light flight and plastic balls up to 60 mph; Throws slowpitch softballs with up to a 12 inches arch
Throws a level pitch to help teach proper swing mechanics. Extremely accurate for throwing strikes, fly balls and even grounders.
The official pitching machine of both Babe Ruth League and Pony Baseball and Softball
It is completely manual, needs no electricity or batteries and is light weight and easy to move from field to field, weighs less than 25 lbs.
Great to set up to use for a variety of drills
